0.content:
**Wylder, Wandering Swordsman**
Class: Melee DPS
Description: A straightforward warrior who excels at close combat. Uses sword techniques and has abilities focused on direct damage and mobility. Good starter character for new players.

1.content:
**Duchess, Mystic Noble**
Class: Mage/Caster
Unlock: Complete specific conditions or Nightlord defeats
Description: Spellcaster using ranged magic attacks with area-of-effect abilities. High damage potential but fragile defenses. Starts with staff and sorceries. Benefits from intelligence-scaling weapons and catalysts.

2.content:
**Ironheart/Ironeye**
Class: Ranged DPS
Description: An archer specializing in precision strikes from distance. Can mark targets and has abilities that increase critical hit chance. Excellent for dealing with priority targets.

3.content:
**Guardian, Stalwart Protector**
Class: Tank
Description: A heavily armored defender who can shield allies and draw enemy attention. Has damage mitigation abilities and can create defensive zones for the team.

4.content:
**Revenant**
Class: Death Knight
Description: An undead warrior who uses death-based abilities. Can resurrect with special conditions and has life-steal mechanics. Risk-reward playstyle character.

5.content:
**Raider**
Class: Berserker
Description: An aggressive melee fighter who gains power through combat. Has rage mechanics and becomes stronger as battles intensify. High risk, high reward gameplay.

6.content:
**Recluse**
Class: Assassin/Rogue
Description: A stealthy fighter who excels at ambush tactics and critical strikes. Can become invisible and has poison-based abilities. Requires tactical positioning.

7.content:
**Templar**
Class: Paladin
Description: A holy warrior who combines combat prowess with divine magic. Can heal allies and smite enemies with sacred power. Versatile support-damage hybrid.

8.content:
**Sanguine Noble**
Role: Merchant/Guide
Description: Mysterious merchant who appears in safe zones. Trades relics and provides cryptic guidance about the Night's Tide. May have connection to Mohg.

9.content:
**Night Maiden**
Role: Quest Giver
Description: Spectral figure who provides objectives and lore. Similar role to Melina but adapted to Nightreign's setting. Appears at specific sites throughout runs.

10.content:
**Lost Tarnished**
Role: Elite Enemies
Description: Former Nightfarers who failed their missions and became corrupted. Act as mini-bosses with Nightfarer-like abilities. Drop valuable relics.

11.content:
**Eclipse Prophet**
Role: Lore Character
Description: Announces the coming of each night phase and provides warnings about Nightlord locations. Found at high vantage points. Speaks in riddles about the Night's origin.

12.content:
**Relic Keeper**
Role: Challenge NPC
Description: Guards powerful relics in hidden locations. Must be defeated or appeased to access top-tier upgrades. Each has unique puzzle or combat requirements.

13.content:
**Revenant, Death Knight**
Class: Hybrid Fighter
Unlock: Complete specific progression requirements
Description: Mysterious unlockable Nightfarer combining melee and dark magic. Uses holy/death themed abilities including halo scythe. Balanced stats allowing flexible builds. Popular for faith-based playstyles.

14.content:
**The Priestess**
Type: Quest NPC
Location: Roundtable Hold
Description: Leader of the Nightfarers who guides the mission against the Night. Provides exposition about the ritual that summoned champions' minds to combat the eternal night. Offers guidance between expeditions.

15.content:
**Iron Menial**
Type: Service NPC
Location: Roundtable Hold
Description: Assists Nightfarers with equipment and upgrades. Similar role to blacksmiths in main game but adapted for roguelike progression. May offer services between runs.

16.content:
**Heolstor, the Night Aspect**
Type: Final Boss
Location: Center of Limveld
Description: The Primordial Night manifested into being. Leader of the Nightlords who commands the Night's Tide. Defeating Heolstor grants the Night Rune and can unlock different endings.

17.content:
**Margit, the Fell Omen (Nightlord)**
Type: Nightlord Boss
Description: Nightreign version of Margit with enhanced abilities. Uses holy hammer and daggers with increased aggression. Adapted to the Night's Tide with new attack patterns.

18.content:
**Godrick the Grafted (Nightlord)**
Type: Nightlord Boss
Description: Nightreign version of Godrick with more grotesque grafting. Dragon arm attacks are enhanced with night energy. More aggressive and unpredictable than base game version.

19.content:
**Red Wolf of Radagon (Nightlord)**
Type: Nightlord Boss
Description: Enhanced version with shadow magic combined with glintstone sorcery. Faster and spawns shadow copies. Pack hunting mechanics in Nightreign.

20.content:
**Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon (Nightlord)**
Type: Nightlord Boss
Description: Nightreign Rennala with corrupted moon magic. Summons are more aggressive and numerous. Second phase features dark moon attacks.

21.content:
**Crucible Knight (Nightlord)**
Type: Nightlord Boss
Description: Elite Crucible Knight empowered by the Night's Tide. Uses enhanced Aspects of the Crucible with shadow properties. Extremely aggressive with reduced openings.

22.content:
**Ancestor Spirit (Nightlord)**
Type: Nightlord Boss
Description: Spectral stag corrupted by eternal night. Heals from slain wildlife and uses enhanced ethereal attacks. Arena changes dynamically during fight.

23.content:
**Astel, Naturalborn of the Void (Nightlord)**
Type: Nightlord Boss
Description: Cosmic horror enhanced by the Night's Tide. Gravity magic mixed with void energy. Teleportation is more frequent with meteor storms.

24.content:
**Shadow Variants**
Type: Common Enemies
Description: Standard Elden Ring enemies corrupted by the Night's Tide. Faster, more aggressive, and have shadow-based attacks. Drop more rewards than normal versions.

25.content:
**Tide Spawn**
Type: Special Enemies
Description: Creatures born from the Night's Tide itself. Only appear in corrupted areas. Incorporeal until attacked. Drop twilight shards abundantly.

26.content:
**Eclipse Knights**
Type: Elite Enemies
Description: Elite warriors who serve the Nightlords. Each type corresponds to a specific Nightlord. Must be defeated to access boss areas.

27.content:
**Nightmare Cavalry**
Type: Roaming Bosses
Description: Enhanced version of Night's Cavalry. Patrol Limveld and chase players aggressively. Drop valuable relics but are extremely dangerous.

28.content:
**Adel, Gaping Jaw (Everdark Sovereign)**
Type: Enhanced Nightlord
Description: Hard mode version starting in second phase. Third phase at 50% HP creates shrinking cyclone forcing team together. Fourth phase further shrinks safe zone. Weak to Poison, Frost, Sleep, Rot. Greatly increased HP and aggression. Multiple leap attacks and AoE bursts. Rewards Dark Night of the Baron relic.

29.content:
**Fulghor, Darkdrift Knight (Everdark Sovereign)**
Type: Enhanced Nightlord
Description: Champion of Nightglow in enhanced form. Starts in second phase with increased speed and new lightning combinations. Third phase adds devastating area denial attacks. Extremely aggressive with reduced attack windows. High lightning resistance recommended.

30.content:
**Gnoster, Wisdom of Night (Everdark Sovereign)**
Type: Enhanced Nightlord
Description: Sentient Pest sovereign form. Enhanced sleep attacks affect entire arena. Third phase adds area-wide sleep pulse requiring constant movement. Can put players to sleep mid-combat. Requires sleep resistance or cleansing items.

31.content:
**Maris, Fathom of Night (Everdark Sovereign)**
Type: Enhanced Nightlord
Description: Enhanced aquatic Nightlord starting in second phase. Third phase adds global sleep spell interruptible with lightning damage. Increased frost attacks and area denial. Requires coordinated lightning damage to prevent party wipes.

32.content:
**Caligo, Miasma of Night (Everdark Sovereign)**
Type: Enhanced Nightlord
Description: Ice dragon sovereign with enhanced frost breath. Speculated to gain additional elemental breaths in third phase. May grow additional heads like a hydra. Frost resistance essential. Currently in rotation as of August 2025.

33.content:
**Limveld**
Region: Parallel Universe
Description: A twisted version of Limgrave consumed by eternal night. Familiar landmarks are corrupted and rearranged. Procedural elements ensure each run feels different.

34.content:
**Stormveil (Night)**
Region: Limveld Castle
Description: Godrick's castle twisted by the Night's Tide. Layout shifts between runs. More vertical and trap-filled than the original. Houses Godrick Nightlord.

35.content:
**Mistwood (Night)**
Region: Limveld Forest
Description: Dense forest where visibility is extremely limited. Home to wolf packs and shadowy creatures. Contains hidden paths that change each run.

36.content:
**Weeping Peninsula (Night)**
Region: Southern Limveld
Description: Cut off section that requires special access. Higher tier enemies and rewards. The Night's Tide moves differently here.

37.content:
**Shadow Catacombs**
Region: Underground Limveld
Description: Network of dungeons that connect different areas. Provide shortcuts but contain elite enemies. Can shelter from Night's Tide temporarily.

38.content:
**Moonlight Altar (Night)**
Region: Elevated Limveld
Description: Floating platforms and towers above Limveld. Accessed through special means. Contains Rennala Nightlord and moon-themed challenges.

39.content:
**Crucible Arena**
Region: Limveld Arena
Description: Colosseum-like structure where Crucible Knight Nightlord resides. Features wave-based challenges before boss. Architecture shifts during combat.

40.content:
**Void Breach**
Region: Reality Tear
Description: Hole in reality where Astel Nightlord emerges. Space itself is distorted here. Gravity works differently and cosmic horrors spawn continuously.

41.content:
**Spirit Shelter**
Type: Endgame Location
Access: After surviving second night via ethereal sap
Description: Divine tower where Nightfarers awaken at Noontide of final day. Contains petrified tree with gate leading to Night of the Nightlord. Critical location for final boss access. Represents boundary between mortal realm and primordial night.

42.content:
**Ethereal Sap**
Type: Transition Zone
Description: Mystical substance Nightfarers enter after second night survival. Transports team to Spirit Shelter for final confrontation. Acts as loading/preparation area before Nightlord battle. Visual spectacle of traveling through night essence.

43.content:
**Night's Tide**
Mechanic: Core System
Description: The encroaching darkness that forces players to keep moving. Acts as a battle royale-style circle that shrinks the playable area. Being caught in it causes rapid damage and death.

44.content:
**Nightfarer Abilities**
Mechanic: Character System
Description: Each Nightfarer has passive abilities, active skills, and ultimate arts. Abilities upgrade through relics found during runs. Synergies between team members are crucial.

45.content:
**Relic System**
Mechanic: Progression
Description: Randomized power-ups found during runs that enhance Nightfarer abilities. Stack to create builds. Lost on death but some progression carries over between runs.

46.content:
**Three Day Cycle**
Mechanic: Time System
Description: Each run lasts three in-game days and nights. Different enemies and challenges appear at different times. Must defeat all Nightlords before time expires.

47.content:
**Revival System**
Mechanic: Co-op Feature
Description: Fallen teammates can be revived at specific shrines or through certain abilities. Limited revival opportunities increase tension. Some Nightfarers have unique revival mechanics.

48.content:
**Limveld Sites**
Mechanic: Checkpoint System
Description: Modified Sites of Grace that work differently in Nightreign. Provide temporary respite from Night's Tide. Can be used to upgrade abilities mid-run with collected resources.

49.content:
**Boss Bounty System**
Mechanic: Reward Structure
Description: Defeating Nightlords grants specific rewards and unlocks. Each boss drops unique relics and progression items. Order of boss defeats affects difficulty and rewards.

50.content:
**Roguelike Progression**
Mechanic: Meta System
Description: Permanent unlocks that persist between runs. Includes new Nightfarers, starting equipment, and passive bonuses. Failed runs still contribute to overall progression.

51.content:
**Everdark Sovereigns**
Mechanic: Enhanced Boss Mode
Description: Weekly rotating hard mode versions of Nightlords. Start in second phase with increased HP, damage, and aggression. Feature new third phase at 50% HP with unique mechanics. Defeat grants Sovereign Sigils currency. First clear rewards 25 sigils, subsequent clears give 5-7. Time-limited availability requiring online connection.

52.content:
**Sovereign Sigils**
Mechanic: Premium Currency
Description: Special currency earned from defeating Everdark Sovereigns. Spent at Collector Signboard in Roundtable Hold. Can purchase exclusive relics, vessel chalices, character skins (garbs), and force Shifting Earth events. First-time defeats grant 25 sigils, repeat victories grant 5-7.

53.content:
**Collector Signboard**
Mechanic: Special Vendor
Description: Unlocked after first Everdark Sovereign defeat. Located near shoreline in Roundtable Hold. Exchanges Sovereign Sigils for: exclusive relics (Dark Night of the Baron, etc.), new vessel chalices, character garbs/skins, ability to force Shifting Earth events. Stock rotates based on defeated Everdark Sovereigns.

54.content:
**Nightreign Endings**
Mechanic: Multiple Endings
Description: Three possible endings based on choices and Remembrance completion. Dawn (default): Present Night Rune to corpse, restore natural order. Endless Night: Complete Ironeye's Remembrance quests, equip Edge of Order, kill corpse to condemn Limveld. New Night: Complete Wylder's Remembrance quests, equip Larval Tear for transformation.

55.content:
**Character Unlocks**
Mechanic: Progression System
Description: Six Nightfarers available at start (Wylder, Guardian, Ironeye, Raider, Recluse, Executor). Two unlockable through progression: Duchess and Revenant. Unlock conditions involve completing specific objectives or defeating certain Nightlords. Switch characters at Character Selection bell near Table of Lost Grace.

56.content:
**Remembrance Quests**
Mechanic: Character Story System
Description: Personal questlines for each Nightfarer accessed through journal entries. Completion requires defeating specific Nightlords or meeting objectives. Rewards include exclusive items and can unlock alternate endings. Ironeye's Edge of Order enables Endless Night ending. Wylder's Larval Tear enables New Night ending.

57.content:
**Night Rune**
Type: Key Item
Description: Obtained by defeating Heolstor. Required for true ending. Can be used to permanently alter Limveld's fate. Multiple endings based on usage.

58.content:
**Shadow Flask**
Type: Consumable
Description: Nightreign's version of healing flasks. Refills at sites but has limited uses per run. Can be upgraded with relics to provide additional effects.

59.content:
**Twilight Shards**
Type: Currency
Description: Primary upgrade currency in Nightreign. Dropped by enemies and found in chests. Used to enhance abilities mid-run. Partially retained between runs.

60.content:
**Nightlord Seals**
Type: Progression Items
Description: Proof of defeating each Nightlord. Required to access Heolstor. Each seal provides passive bonuses for the remainder of the run.

61.content:
**Eclipse Relics**
Type: Legendary Items
Description: Rarest relics that fundamentally change Nightfarer abilities. Only one can be equipped per run. Game-changing effects but come with drawbacks.

62.content:
**Void Compass**
Type: Tool
Description: Shows the Night's Tide movement pattern and safe zones. Upgrades reveal Nightlord locations and hidden areas. Essential for navigation in later days.

63.content:
**Resurrection Effigy**
Type: Consumable
Description: Allows instant revival of all fallen teammates. Extremely rare. Single use per run. Can change the outcome of difficult encounters.

64.content:
**Dark Night of the Baron**
Type: Exclusive Relic
Source: Defeat Everdark Sovereign Adel
Effect: Enhanced damage during night phases. Increases resistance to grab attacks. Synergizes with aggressive playstyles. One of the most sought-after Everdark rewards.

65.content:
**Edge of Order**
Type: Remembrance Item
Source: Complete Ironeye's Remembrance quests
Effect: Special item that enables Endless Night ending when equipped during final boss. Represents Ironeye's desire to impose order through eternal darkness. Key item for alternate ending.

66.content:
**Larval Tear (Nightreign)**
Type: Remembrance Item
Source: Complete Wylder's Remembrance quests
Effect: Enables New Night ending when equipped during final boss. Allows transformation and rebirth themes. Different from main game's respec item.

67.content:
**Vessel Chalices**
Type: Meta Progression Item
Source: Collector Signboard (Sovereign Sigils)
Effect: Permanent upgrades affecting starting conditions or relic chances. Part of roguelike meta-progression system. Various types available offering different benefits.
